description: The Flame of the Forest is a beautiful, low-maintenance flowering tree native to India and areas of Southeast Asia. It can reach heights of up to 25 feet and is adorned with bright yellow, papery flowers that bloom at the start of the rainy season. Its interesting shape and bright colors make it a great addition to any garden or outdoor space. They are hardy and drought tolerant even in the hottest weather, and they attract beautiful butterfly and bee pollinators. Flame of the Forest flowers are edible as well, commonly used to make drinks, food, and medicine. Their hardy, beautiful nature makes them an amazing addition to any garden or outdoor area.
